intro: Plocama somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali plocama, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
